title.narrative: Reinventing displaced universities: enhancing competitiveness, serving communities

description.narrative: The programme is based on six specific objectives: 1. To improve infrastructure of three DHEIs for realisation of innovative and partnership-based approaches in administrative and teaching practices (by creating a co-working area in each institution). 2. To enhance competence of administrative and academic staff, as well as students of three DHEIs enbling them to provide good governance, contributing to T&L excellence and internationalization in HE. 3. To upgrade/generate institutional development strategies, including realisation of principles of good governance, T&L excellence and internationalisation and launch their implementation at operational level. 4. To modernize curricula of three DHEIs in line with Bologna principles and due respect of T&L excellence, good governance and internationalisation. 5. To ensure active role and effective impact on students and academic staff in university, good governance, T&L excellence, internationalisation as well as implementation of institutional development strategies. 6. To strengthen cooperation between DHEIs and local communities, contribute to social and economic recovery by sharing project resources and outputs and extending services to different groups of stakeholders.

The project "Reinventing displaced universities: enhancing competitiveness, serving communities" is a 36-month project aimed at raising attractiveness and competitiveness of 3 displaced higher education institutions (DHEIs) by enhancing their institutional capability, good governance, teaching and learning (T&L) excellence and internationalisation. It will be delivered by the Institute of Higher Education of the National Academy of Educational Sciences of Ukraine (IHE) working with four co-beneficiaries and will operate across all the Government-controlled areas (GCA) of Donetsk and Luhansk regions. The British Council as one of the co-beneficiaries will ensure that the best UK expertise will be available to support DHEIs in their further development.
Three displaced higher education institutions (8300 students and 990 staff); Volodymyr Dahl East Ukrainian University, Donetsk State University of Management, Luhansk National Agrarian University.
